content:
ConsoleLogger Class

In this Article

Represents the default logger that outputs event data to the console (stdout).

Syntax

Declaration

public class ConsoleLogger : Microsoft.Build.Framework.INodeLogger

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ConsoleLogger

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

This class creates, wraps, and delegates to a BaseConsoleLogger, either SerialConsoleLogger or ParallelConsoleLogger.

This class is not thread safe.

Constructors summary

ConsoleLogger()

Creates a default logger.
ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity)

Creates a logger instance with the given verbosity that logs to the default console.
ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity,WriteHandler,ColorSetter,ColorResetter)

Initializes the logger with alternate output handlers.

Properties summary

Parameters

Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of parameter key-value pairs.
ShowSummary

Gets or sets a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of errors and the warnings summary.
SkipProjectStartedText

Gets or sets a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of project headers.
Verbosity

Gets or sets the level of detail to show in the event log.
WriteHandler

Provides access to the write handler delegate so that it can be redirected if necessary (e.g. to a file).

Methods summary

ApplyParameter(String,String)

Applies a parameter to the logger.
BuildFinishedHandler(Object,BuildFinishedEventArgs)

Called when the build is finished.
BuildStartedHandler(Object,BuildStartedEventArgs)

Called when the build is started.
CustomEventHandler(Object,CustomBuildEventArgs)

Called to log a custom event.
ErrorHandler(Object,BuildErrorEventArgs)

Called to log an error event.
Initialize(IEventSource)

Signs up the console logger for the given build event.
Initialize(IEventSource,Int32)

Initializes the logger with the given event source and node count.
MessageHandler(Object,BuildMessageEventArgs)

Called to log a message event.
ProjectFinishedHandler(Object,ProjectFinishedEventArgs)

Called to log a project finished event.
ProjectStartedHandler(Object,ProjectStartedEventArgs)

Called to log a project started event.
Shutdown()

Called when the build is finished.
TargetFinishedHandler(Object,TargetFinishedEventArgs)

Called to log a target finished event.
TargetStartedHandler(Object,TargetStartedEventArgs)

Called to log a target started event.
TaskFinishedHandler(Object,TaskFinishedEventArgs)

Called to log a task finished event.
TaskStartedHandler(Object,TaskStartedEventArgs)

Called to log a task started event.
WarningHandler(Object,BuildWarningEventArgs)

Called to log a warning event.

Constructors

  • ConsoleLogger()

    Creates a default logger.

    public ConsoleLogger ();
  • ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity)

    Creates a logger instance with the given verbosity that logs to the default console.

    public ConsoleLogger (Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity verbosity);

    Parameters

    • verbosity
      LoggerVerbosity

      The verbosity level.

  • ConsoleLogger(LoggerVerbosity,WriteHandler,ColorSetter,ColorResetter)

    Initializes the logger with alternate output handlers.

    public ConsoleLogger (Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity verbosity, Microsoft.Build.Logging.WriteHandler write, Microsoft.Build.Logging.ColorSetter colorSet, Microsoft.Build.Logging.ColorResetter colorReset);

    Parameters

    • verbosity
      LoggerVerbosity

      The verbosity level.

    • write
      WriteHandler

      The write handler.

    • colorSet
      ColorSetter

      Sets the text color.

    • colorReset
      ColorResetter

      Resets the text color.

Properties

  • Parameters

    Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of parameter key-value pairs.

    public string Parameters { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a semicolon-delimited list of parameter key-value pairs.

  • ShowSummary

    Gets or sets a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of errors and the warnings summary.

    public bool ShowSummary { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of errors and the warnings summary.

  • SkipProjectStartedText

    Gets or sets a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of project headers.

    public bool SkipProjectStartedText { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns a switch that determines whether to suppress the display of project headers.

    Remarks

    Project headers are displayed by default unless this property is set.

  • Verbosity

    Gets or sets the level of detail to show in the event log.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Verbosity { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • LoggerVerbosity

      Returns the level of detail to show in the event log.

  • WriteHandler

    Provides access to the write handler delegate so that it can be redirected if necessary (e.g. to a file).

    protected Microsoft.Build.Logging.WriteHandler WriteHandler { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • WriteHandler

      Returns the write handler delegate.

Methods

  • ApplyParameter(String,String)

    Applies a parameter to the logger.

    public void ApplyParameter (string parameterName, string parameterValue);

    Parameters

    • parameterName
      String

      The name of the parameter.

    • parameterValue
      String

      The value of the parameter.

    Remarks

    Deprecated.

  • BuildFinishedHandler(Object,BuildFinishedEventArgs)

    Called when the build is finished.

    public void BuildFinishedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildFinishedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender (should be null).

    • e
      BuildFinishedEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • BuildStartedHandler(Object,BuildStartedEventArgs)

    Called when the build is started.

    public void BuildStartedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildStartedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender (should be null).

    • e
      BuildStartedEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • CustomEventHandler(Object,CustomBuildEventArgs)

    Called to log a custom event.

    public void CustomEventHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.CustomBuildEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender of the event.

    • e
      CustomBuildEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • ErrorHandler(Object,BuildErrorEventArgs)

    Called to log an error event.

    public void ErrorHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildErrorEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender of the event.

    • e
      BuildErrorEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • Initialize(IEventSource)

    Signs up the console logger for the given build event.

    public virtual void Initialize (Microsoft.Build.Framework.IEventSource eventSource);

    Parameters

    • eventSource
      IEventSource

      The available events.

  • Initialize(IEventSource,Int32)

    Initializes the logger with the given event source and node count.

    public virtual void Initialize (Microsoft.Build.Framework.IEventSource eventSource, int nodeCount);

    Parameters

    • eventSource
      IEventSource

      The event source.

    • nodeCount
      Int32

      The node count.

  • MessageHandler(Object,BuildMessageEventArgs)

    Called to log a message event.

    public void MessageHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildMessageEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender of the event.

    • e
      BuildMessageEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • ProjectFinishedHandler(Object,ProjectFinishedEventArgs)

    Called to log a project finished event.

    public void ProjectFinishedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectFinishedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender (should be null).

    • e
      ProjectFinishedEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • ProjectStartedHandler(Object,ProjectStartedEventArgs)

    Called to log a project started event.

    public void ProjectStartedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.ProjectStartedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • sender
      System.Object

      The sender (should be null).

    • e
      ProjectStartedEventArgs

      The event arguments.

  • Shutdown()

    Called when the build is finished.

    public virtual void Shutdown ();

    Remarks

    The console logger does not need to release any resources. This method does nothing.

  • TargetFinishedHandler(Object,TargetFinishedEventArgs)

    Called to log a target finished event.

    public void TargetFinishedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.TargetFinishedEventArgs e);

      The sender (should be null).

    public void TargetStartedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.TargetStartedEventArgs e);

  • TaskFinishedHandler(Object,TaskFinishedEventArgs)

    public void TaskFinishedHandler (object sender, Microsoft.Build.Framework.TaskFinishedEventArgs e);
